org.miktim.websocket

Interface WsConnection.Handler

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    WsConnection.EventHandler
    Enclosing class:
    WsConnection

    public static interface WsConnection.Handler
    WebSocket connection events handler.

    There are two scenarios for handling connection events:
    - onError - onClose, when SSL/WebSocket handshake failed;
    - onOpen - [onMessage - onMessage - ...] - [onError] - onClose.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onClose(WsConnection conn, WsStatus status)
      Called when the WebSocket connection closed.
      void onError(WsConnection conn, java.lang.Throwable e)
      Called when the WebSocket connection or handler error occured.
      void onMessage(WsConnection conn, java.io.InputStream is, boolean isUTF8Text)
      Called when a WebSocket message is received.
      void onOpen(WsConnection conn, java.lang.String subProtocol)
      Called when opening a WebSocket connection.

    • Method Detail

      • onOpen

        void onOpen(WsConnection conn,
            java.lang.String subProtocol)
        Called when opening a WebSocket connection.
        Parameters:
        conn - WebSocket connection.
        subProtocol - the negotiated WebSocket sub protocol or null if the client did not requests it or if the server does not agree to any of the client's requested sub protocols.

      • onMessage

        void onMessage(WsConnection conn,
               java.io.InputStream is,
               boolean isUTF8Text)
        Called when a WebSocket message is received.

        - the WebSocket message is represented by an input stream of binary data or UTF-8 encoded text;
        - exiting method closes the stream.

        Parameters:
        conn - WebSocket connection.
        is - message input stream.
        isUTF8Text - if true, the stream is UTF-8 encoded text. Otherwise, it is a binary data stream.

      • onError

        void onError(WsConnection conn,
             java.lang.Throwable e)
        Called when the WebSocket connection or handler error occured.

        - any error closes the WebSocket connection;
        - allocating large buffers may throw an OutOfMemoryError.

        Parameters:
        conn - WebSocket connection.
        e - connection error.

      • onClose

        void onClose(WsConnection conn,
             WsStatus status)
        Called when the WebSocket connection closed.
        Parameters:
        conn - WebSocket connection.
        status - connection status.
        See Also:
        WsStatus
